It gives them a private venue to keep a daily record of their thoughts, feelings, and ideas, and can motivate children to express themselves more than they otherwise would. However, children can have short attention spans, and may quickly tire of journaling or run out of ideas to write about. If you?'d like your children to develop a habit of daily journal writing, plan to provide them with the needed supplies and encourage them to write through prompts and other fun writing exercises.
